courses.YIDD 1 — First-Year Yiddish:
Course: YIDD 1 — First-Year Yiddish
Credits: 5
Description: Introduces the Yiddish language. Students learn to speak and to ask others in Yiddish about themselves and about common situations (the classroom, work, family), and learn to read and write simple Yiddish texts.
Requirements: No additional requirements listed.
courses.YIDD 2 — First-Year Yiddish:
Course: YIDD 2 — First-Year Yiddish
Credits: 5
Description: Follows YIDD 1 , expanding vocabulary to include the weather, physical health and sickness, holidays, clothing, etc., and increasing student ability for self-expression using different tenses and grammatical cases.
Requirements: Requirements Prerequisite(s): YIDD 1 or by consent of instructor.
courses.YIDD 3 — First-Year Yiddish:
Course: YIDD 3 — First-Year Yiddish
Credits: 5
Description: Follows YIDD 2 , expanding vocabulary to include food, travel, and academic life, with an emphasis on the expression of feelings and opinions, agreement and disagreement, making use of all tenses and all grammatical cases.
Requirements: Requirements Prerequisite(s): YIDD 2 or by permission of the instructor.
courses.YIDD 99F — Tutorial:
Course: YIDD 99F — Tutorial
Credits: 2
Description: Students submit petition to sponsoring agency.
Requirements: Repeatable for credit Yes
